page.title: 09FARMS IN CHADDESLEY CORBETT
page.content: In Chaddesley Corbett, in the marked area,there are some two dozen farms. Not all are food productive farms. Five of them rear sheep for wool and meat, 3 of them rear cattle for meat. Both the sheep and cattle are bought and sold at the local cattle markets. There are 3 dairy farms which produce milk which is collected and sold by the Milk Marketing Board. Nine farms grow sugar beet for processing at the sugar beet factory in Kidderminster. Nine farms grow cereal crops, mostly wheat and barley. Some barley is sold for brewing and some winter wheat is used for animal feed. The straw is used for bedding. Grass is grown for hay & silage. Four farms grow potatoes.One farm specialises in agricultural contracting especially combine harvesting.
